title: UBA Launches 2nd National Essay Competition
text:
30 September 2015 15:33 CET UBA Launches 2nd National Essay Competition By Daily Guide 
Winner of last year's competition receives her prize from Okudjeto Ablakwa while the MD of UBA and other officials look 
The United Bank for Africa (UBA) Foundation launched its Second National Essay Competition for Senior High School (SHS) students recently as part of its corporate social responsibility. 
The project is geared towards heightening SHS students' interest in the English language. 
Managing Director of UBA, Abiola Bawuah said the project was churning out good results already especially as winners of the maiden competition had been admitted into the university. 
'This year we are going a step further by getting every school in Ghana to participate and we intend to follow up on them.' 
She said the UBA Foundation was monitoring participants to ensure they gained admissions into the universities through their academic performance. 
She recounted how an awardee encountered some difficulties at the KNUST in her bid to read medicine but the problem was resolved through the interference of the UBA Foundation. 
UBA Foundation, Madam Bawuah added, would introduce other schemes next month at the universities and they would include scholarship and grants as well as perhaps endowment cheques for English language students. 
'It is actually a full educational programme that we are running,' she added. 
Samuel Okudjeto-Ablakwa, Deputy Minister for Education, officially launched the competition. 
He mentioned that government was disappointed with the past WASSCE examination results in which over 19 percent of the candidates failed in English. 
To participate in the competition, a student has to be enrolled in a Senior High School and write on what various matters. 
This year the winners would receive GH¢20,000 and a trophy, she said. 
GH¢14,000 and a plaque would go to the 1st Runner-up, while the 2nd Runner-up would receive GH¢8,000 and a plaque. All 12 finalists would get laptops.
